description: Unique row identifier for this purchase order settings record.
Legal or display name of the buying organization printed on purchase documents.
Street address line 1 of the buying organization used on purchase documents.
City for the buying organization’s address.
State or province for the buying organization’s address.
Postal or ZIP code for the buying organization’s address.
Main telephone number for purchasing correspondence.
Fax number used for purchasing correspondence.
Custom user-defined field for additional purchasing information; semantics vary by client.
Another user-defined field for additional purchasing information; semantics vary by client.
Default sales/use tax rate applied to new purchase orders; confirm units and jurisdiction with SME.
Likely flag or code controlling integration with inventory receipts from purchase orders; confirm with SME.
Likely setting indicating whether requisitions are required/enabled before creating a purchase order; confirm with SME.
Alphanumeric prefix prepended to generated purchase order numbers.
Beginning number in the purchase order numbering sequence or range.
Ending number in the purchase order numbering sequence or range.
Current or last assigned purchase order number in the sequence.
Default transaction type for new orders (e.g., regular, blanket, quote); confirm available codes with SME.
Standard footer or terms text printed on purchase documents.
Default ship-to name shown on purchase documents.
Default ship-to address line 1.
City for the default ship-to address.
State or province for the default ship-to address.
Postal or ZIP code for the default ship-to address.
Primary contact person for purchasing communications.
Default taxable status or tax code applied to new orders; confirm code set with SME.
Rule or flag to automatically close orders when fully received or after defined criteria.
Default general ledger or cost account charged when creating new orders; confirm account format with SME.
Username or identifier of the user who created the record.
Date and time the record was created.
Username or identifier of the user who last modified the record.
Date and time of the most recent modification.
Identifier of the report layout used to print requisitions.
Identifier of the report layout used to print standard purchase orders.
Identifier of the report layout used to print blanket purchase orders.
Identifier of the report layout used to print request-for-quote documents.
Key linking this record to stored file attachments or a document repository.
Setting controlling whether ordered quantities may be overridden after creation or receipt; confirm behavior with SME.
Likely integration link or ledger key for inbound purchase order transactions; confirm purpose with SME.
Temporary flag used during approval workflow processing; confirm lifecycle with SME.
Setting to automatically reopen orders when returns, changes, or backorders occur; confirm conditions with SME.
Rule or threshold enabling automatic approval of orders under defined limits; confirm policy with SME.
Street address line 2 for the buying organization’s address.
